column4: Is there a way I can force my desktop to not have any icons on it -- like right now I have a usb drive plugged in and it put a 'usbdrive' icon on my desktop thus ruining my background image... how can I get around that?
but knowing how on a particular icon is great info as well
I have a laptop with wireless networking built in --- but it does not work for Ubuntu... what do I do? :)
shockingly it gives that I am connected to a wireless network :P lol
apparently I am fortunate and I dont have to worry about any drivers
... how can I see a list of all wireless networks and choose the one I wish to connect to?
so can you ping the routers IP?
try ping 192.168.0.1 ,this is usually the IP of router
ok so thats a good sign
Well one question... how can I instruct my pings to use eth1 instead of eth0 ?
hm... are you connected with the same computer on a wire now?
i.e. I have an ethernet cable plugged in in addition to wireless -- which is obviously how I am on IRC :)
